name: Family Dynamics
description: The harmonious ordering of relationships within structured systems. Like a well-functioning family unit, this represents the balanced interplay of roles and responsibilities.
image: Wind above fire, spreading warmth through gentle influence

lines_in_transition.6: External factors affect the system; Maintain internal cohesion - Maintain internal cohesion
lines_in_transition.5: Leadership through example; Guide with wisdom - Guide with wisdom
lines_in_transition.4: Supporting the whole through individual growth; Contribute positively - Contribute positively
lines_in_transition.3: Addressing imbalances firmly but fairly; Restore harmony - Restore harmony
lines_in_transition.2: Nurturing the core relationships; Build strong foundations - Build strong foundations
lines_in_transition.1: Establishing basic principles; Set proper boundaries - Set proper boundaries

tholonic_analysis.negotiation: Balances individual needs with collective harmony. Shows how different roles must negotiate their relationships while maintaining system integrity.
tholonic_analysis.limitation: Creates structure through clear roles and responsibilities. Each element has defined boundaries that support the whole.
tholonic_analysis.contribution: Demonstrates how ordered relationships create stable, evolving systems. Like a healthy ecosystem, each part supports the whole.
tholonic_analysis.significance_in_thologram: Represents fundamental patterns of ordered relationships. Shows how complex systems maintain stability through clear structure.

no_moving_lines: Indicates a period of stable relationships and clear roles. Maintain existing structures while nurturing connections.
all_moving_lines: Signals fundamental transformation in relationship patterns. Prepare for new dynamics while preserving core principles.
